LXhkS8XUwgreqOB0VrO6CA.text: Wang's is great for Chinese take-out. Not special inside, if your thinking of eating in.. florescent lights overhead seem to warp space and time, amid their collection of Chinese artifacts. But Dang the food is amazing, get an egg roll no matter what. The prices are fair market value for Chinese take-out. I've had a handful of different dishes and all have been very impressive. If your nearby and looking for Chinese, give them a call, and get yourself ready for a mouthful of Wang's!

rQO8LszNv-B-N0vjEARRlA.text: This place is so good.. the best I've had in the realm of Chinese take-out.  They are speedy and consistently tasty.   I love the mixed vegetables in garlic sauce, vegetable lo mein, and their fried dumplings!  No complaints.

haG8NCHb7PJ45iB2SxO7Bw.text: Good general tso chicken, could provide more sauce, crab ragoon is very good.  I do like the hot and sour soup, one of the best in area.  Egg rolls are good, but not great.  That is why only 4 stars.

k_P3KPtyV4LOvxmN8NfoSQ.text: I love their General Tso chicken.  I've had general tso from several places and this is the best.  Has a nice spice to it and it's always hot when I get delivery.  I love thie crab rangoo and vegetable lo mein.  I had the szechuan chicken and it was good but I probably wouldn't order it again.

7BqqiU9cvScn0KL0njpGlA.text: The food is mediocre at best, and the customer service is poor. My husband and I have ordered from this place a few times now. I have been disappointed each time. The first time I ordered General Tso's tofu, but it turned out to be a gross, soggy, breaded tofu smothered in General Tso's sauce. For our second experience with this restaurant, my husband ordered Mongolian Beef, but they gave him chicken instead. The third time I ordered from them I got lectured about not telling them I had a coupon when I placed my order. I don't think I'll be ordering from them again... I'll drive a bit further to find another Chinese restaurant if it means I can have better food and customer service.

ZoQUVkLeppoXKY5E2fzFNw.text: Friendly staff and crazy fast at making food. Everything I've had has come in large portions at a cheap price. The Crab Rangoon is apparently made in the restaurant as well and is out of this world. Highly recommended to anyone in or around the Brentwood/Carrick community.

9oDX2u72_rR3zY0ot-nnJw.text: The General Tso and Lo Mein dishes are excellent.  I normally have my order delivered and they are always on time. Prices are very reasonable and portions are large enough for 2 people to share.  I highly recommend Wang's!

pS_J92tSHtp4SgvlM3FI-Q.text: My dad likes this place it's ok in my opinion not the best not the worst. I know they moo ed from carrick to Brentwood

RT9GZGaJKxaOUaKRPfBbOA.text: Ordered general tso's chicken combo, sesame chicken combo, chicken lo mien, crab rangoons, and wonton soup.  Both the general tso and the sesame where crisp (like I like it) with plenty of sauce.    The Rangoon's and egg rolls where crispy and cooked perfectly.  I would have enjoyed sweet and sour sauce for the rangoons but I'll know to ask for it next time.  The fried rice and lo mien where exactly what it should be.  And the wontons in the soup where cooked well and very juicy

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I was bummed their was a menu on here so here&#39;s one
Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken lo mien
Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wonton soup

Y2mIaiGywKpkQfaKCiox_Q.text: The only one of two places I will order Chinese from. Safe, tastes normal, fast delivery.

pNOgkk9XaGTu87JGYsbJdw.text: As far as American-Chinese delivery-type food goes (and I am a huge fan of this genre), this is one of the best places I've been to in a long time. This place is mostly take-out or delivery but has some limited seating indoors. It does have a hole-in-the-wall vibe inside, but it is still clean and sanitary. I didn't eat-in, but I wouldn't be afraid to do so. As an added bonus, the woman who took my order over the phone spoke perfect English. Just a small thing, but it was a little less stressful ordering over the phone without the added worry of a language barrier.   I ordered the crab rangoon and was really pleased. These are the triangle-shaped ones, and they were some of the best I have ever had, though it's hard to explain why. The dough seems a bit thicker than what I'm used to but it works because the rangoons themselves seemed to be more fully stuffed. The thicker dough makes for a chewy center and crispy outside. They are perfectly fried and crispy--no heat lamp rubber texture or burnt crust on these guys. There is nothing particularly different about these rangoons, they are just done right all the way, and it totally pays off.   As I always do at these places, I ordered a dish with garlic sauce. In this case, it was shrimp with garlic sauce. The sauce was as expected, sweet and garlic-y with a slight spicy kick. The vegetables were superb. I notice with this type of food the vegetables are often limp and flavorless, functioning chiefly as a vessel to delivery gobs of sauce into your pie hole. Not so at Wang's, however. All the vegetables maintain an appropriate level of crunchiness and flavor. I remember exclaiming to my boyfriend, "I can taste the flavor of the different vegetables!" They are still cooked, but just not cooked to death. I think They probably make food to order, because I ordered close to closing and there was no indication that my food had been swimming in sauce for hours. The shrimp was also great--decent portion, good size, perfectly cooked  The prices at this place are pretty standard, if not a little lower than comparable restaurants. Overall I was really impressed and can't wait to go back.

BXjrDRjV6rbDaNxPGb2uNg.text: YUM!  Okay, so let me first just say that getting take out/delivery is always a disappointment; the food is never as hot as you want it, the food is also a bit mushier than you want it.  HOWEVER, my first time at Wang's, and ordering delivery none the less was great!  The crab rangoons...honestly, some of the best that I've tasted in a LONG time!  They were huge, sweet, and delicious!    I also got the sesame chicken...which was good.  I say good, because something that's fried and covered in a sauce never travels well (my own mistake for ordering it), but overall the best delivery Chinese food I've had in a long time!  One thing to note though, it was dark chicken meat.  Overall, I really enjoyed Wang's!  The food was good, fairly priced, and they deliver to my house!  Win/win/win!

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hot &amp; Spicy Shrimp
Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sesame Chicken
Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Rangoon (the order comes with more, but I couldn&#39;t resist!)

tdK-Un7m_t_I5wV6VDYKzQ.text: Reallllly good Chinese takeout!  I've ordered from a couple other Chinese spots in the area prior to discovering Wangs. Not sure of the name of it, but the one in the Brownsville shopping plaza is gross.   Anyway, Wangs has really good food. I've ordered from them twice now and it was great both times. Try the General Tso's and Crab Rangoons!

4sqIGR8ApPZY9XUbPLiN6Q.text: We had delivery from here: Chicken Lo Mein and General Tso's.  As others have said, it's your standard Chinese cuisine, but it was delivered hot. Not warm, but hot.  The egg roll was perfect and crunchy.  The Lo Mein was a little on the bland side with very little beside noodles and chicken, and so we'll ask for more veggies next time.  The General Tso's sauce tasted closer to a Sweet & Sour sauce than a sweet, slightly spicy sauce, which is likely my preference and restaurant recipe differences.  The chicken breading was thick and soggy, but they were kind enough to accommodate my request for all white-meat chicken. Portion size was standard, and delivery was quick (under 20 minutes).  Price was typical as well.  So, if you're looking for basic, quick cuisine, you'll find it in this place.

MDYvmy8nKJKOlmX-QVShig.text: Perfect place for fast and delicious Chinese food. The new location is in a much better place and has some seating as well. I had the general tso's shrimp for the first time and it was delicious. The portions are big so it's perfect for having leftovers for lunch the next day.

6YWMo57FQwAWvKJTzGL0yA.text: Best Chinese take out in the area. Its all the standard fair. The ingredients are always fresh, the service friendly and it just tastes good. I have been ordering from here since I moved to Pittsburgh and its the benchmark for my Chinese Food here in town.

xN3YNs_nT73-G3J04qrzLg.text: This place was shocking.  I would have given it a 5 star but I have had better Chinese takeout in my life...but honestly, I can't remember when or from where.  Yelp must not have been around back then to keep track.    This place is not a fine dining establishment and I've never dined in as it's just your average unassuming chinese joint.  That being said, we ordered from them one night expecting your typical average - below average experience but were pleasantly surprised.  As everyone has said, the General Tsos is quite good but nothing incredible.  From there, things only got better.  Their egg rolls are perfectly done and crispy.  The crab rangoons were outstanding.  But the real show stopper to me were the Chicken Teriyaki sticks.  These things transported me to a street vendor in Shanghai with every bite.  Sweet, salty, smokey.  These things were juicy inside and crispy and delicious outside.  Order them and thank me later.    Oh, one last thing the beef and broccoli was mediocre at best.  This review was brought to you by Mr. Bluejay and the letter C.

pNzh9nWJUKmY2zevbwPSFw.text: Always happy with our meals! It's your typical American delivery cheap Chinese but it far outranks any other delivery I've had in the area. I especially like their crab Rangoon (loaded with cream cheese so don't expect crab filled ones like you'd get in Baltimore). Food is never super greasy. Fried rice is just rice, onions, and meat/shrimp so not packed with veggies (for me it's perfect with just rice and chicken- I don't like raw onion). Husband likes to try something different most of the time and has never been disappointed but his comfort go-to is the Singapore Mai fun. Service is always super quick- they say 45 min but are always here in under 20. Love this place!

GnITb_BDibGddDpwVa-iFA.text: Idk if it's because I just moved back to Pittsburgh over the summer & Chinese there is over abundant & amazing, but I think this place is sub par at best. The food is tolerable; the egg foo yung is great[ly tolerable], but anything fried (like fried rice, not egg rolls our Rangoon) always has a burnt/cigarette-type taste. I ordered lo mein and it had that same disappointing burnt taste. I have learned what to stay away from, so I will continue to order from Wang's, but I'm terrified to try anything new, so I more than likely won't. I always get delivery and they are always pretty prompt. The delivery guy is always very nice. The good service also will keep my service..all in all, I guess you can't go wrong. It's worth a try.

QrfcBdm9A1Di1L9FywtJBg.text: Very reliable for prompt delivery and accuracy. The food is essentially the same as any other chinese take-out placein the city. However, it is consistently prepared correctly and arrives hot. Fried foods such as egg rolls arrive hot and crispy, which is hard to find with delivery. They will accomodate special requests such as extra spicy, no mushrooms, etc. My personal favorites are the hot and sour soup, General Tso's chicken, and vegetable Mai Fun. I've been ordering from here once or twice a month for several years and not had any bad experiences. Basic chinese takeout fare; but they do a great job in the kitchen and in regards to service. 4 stars because there is nothing unique or especially spectacular on the menu.

7nnTNpZrtUfWC7IjJDcS_A.text: Food was good just wish the chicken would have been crispy but over all it was ok we got it delivery an they where here in 30 an very nice people

vBmqRevC2xZkHMNfHwLtaw.text: I crave their food. I crave their kindness. I crave their fast delivery!!!!! If you need comfort food order from these people !!!! Never had better dumplings , never had better lo mein... Never had better wontons !!!! I love them !!!

STjxhKQyTmwx1CuGAo3xTg.text: I don't like this place at all, yet my Dad wants to eat nothing else. He loves the Sichuan Chicken and I can tolerate the Tso's.

cYE3_E6ntgQqj1wZOOSsuQ.text: Tonight, the family unit and I dined on takeout from Wang's Kitchen of Brentwood, resulting in back-to-back nights of A-1 Chinese food.   Wang's Shrimp Egg Rolls are a tightly-packed, deep-fried delight. Their Chicken Teriyaki sticks are savory street food of an exemplary nature. Beef Fried Rice is another dish they make adeptly as tender chunks of beef hide within the lighter-than-air rice like carnivoric treasures. Fat like pierogi, wide like winged, extraterrestrial ships, the restaurant's Fried Pork Dumplings stand up against the boiled variety I had last night at Station Square's Sesame Inn but in a completely different way. Sesame Inn's are polite, delicate; Wang's are down and dirty like a gang of surly, suppressed steel workers turned striking, street fighting revolutionaries.   The real story, however, centers around something mystical called Singapore Mei Fun, and was it ever Fun for My mouth. Curry dusted rice noodles weave a web in which succulent, sublimely cooked baby shrimp and chicken bits are hopelessly caught. Richness and delectability supervenes.    P.S. The minimum order for delivery is $8. The minimum charge for credit cards is $10. Dine-in seating is very limited.

HrwUOLQmXprHRJK3GeolQg.text: Wonderful Chinese food, the best in this area (Carrick/Brentwood) for sure!  Sauces are fresh and light, not tons of salt or sugar like many Americanized Chinese restaurants. Fresh garlic and ginger used in sauces.  I recommend the chicken with broccoli. My sister Vi said their shrimp and broccoli is "astounding" and that overall, "The food is of a gourmet caliber!" I agree, you really are getting a great value for the price. Our meal of two dishes, hot & sour soup and crab rangoon was $23. You can easily pay 20% or even 50% more at other restaurants in the city and the food isn't even nearly as good.   I must make a particular mention of the hot & sour soup. Making this soup is truly an art and out of the literally dozens of places in the city where I've tried it none compare to Wang's Kitchen. The perfect balance between sour and spicy, the perfect viscosity of the soup base - neither too gelatinous nor too watery, just the right amount of salt and the ample amount of Chinese mushrooms makes it just magnificent. Be sure to get the crispy fried noodles to eat with your hot & sour soup!  4 stars for Wang's Kitchen!

DXkP7ZL70Qis7RTAyKUElQ.text: I just moved to Carrick from Dormont and I was looking for a GREAT place for Chinese food that delivered. I used to order Amazing Wok and was so sad to be leaving that area! I ordered Wang's on a Friday night well home alone while my husband was at work. I got a dinner (Tsos) and Rangoons for $12! Portions were big and food was EXCELLENT! They also quoted me at 40 minutes, and arrived in 25! The Rangoons were BY FAR the best I've EVER had! I think the kicker that made this place amazing for me is that I called on a Sunday night  at 9:35 and asked when they stopped delivering. They told me 10:00 but were more than happy to deliver at that time! For that, I will forever be a failthful customer! Amazing service!

tu2NCSAJD7oD5RczZJ0ooA.text: General tso's is bomb, huge portion for about $10, had it about 8 times never been disappointed

NZFI9Pp1OSp0eCoLHPFK6Q.text: We always love ordering from Wang's. Good food and good service.  General Tso's is our favorite.

yp1sd7Go0qG7sW7Q_EGirQ.text: I must say I do appreciate the newer location closer to the borough building, and my house, rather than where Wangs used to be near Burger King in Brentwood. I have to say that there isn't much different here than any other Chinese restaurant. I wouldn't eat in here it's more of a take out or delivery style. Orders are always 10 minutes and due to the location it is great for me when wanting Chinese quickly. The prices are average, typical $7-15.   My main reason for only 3 stars is the staff here isn't very personable. The service is sort of shove your plastic bag with your food in it in front of you, give your total and give money. The woman there almost everytime I've been there isn't very friendly and very expressionless. Just seems cold to me as if unappreciative of customers. I think it would make the customer's experience more pleasant with better, friendlier service as well as make you want to come back to the restaurant. Otherwise the food is good and quickly put together.

w5U_AGCuhgjTUCrveBEihA.text: We stopped in today in between lunch and dinner, looking for something quick that would satisfy us for dinner as well.  We dined in, although it looks like most folks do take out or get it delivered.  The dining area was very clean, but the food was served on a thin styrofoam plate. Most annoying was the very pliable plastic fork - it was impossible to pierce the veggies.  I got the small chicken with cashews and it tasted fine, but later my mouth felt really puckered from the salt.   The food was very reasonably priced, even the bottled water was reasonable, and the service was very quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cashew chicken

6FOpnIV1juzcVcmSdgxUmg.text: Really impressive little place! I've eaten here a good bit of times now and it's always good! It's a non suspecting little Chinese (mainly takeout) place on Brownsville road, and I think they do a great job! The delivery is always efficient and the food is always good and hot and tasty! The prices are very reasonable and they have a great selection of different Chinese items you can try! It's not the best Chinese I've ever had in my whole life, but in may be the best simple takeout cheap Chinese I've had. They're also always nice and the delivery drivers are friendly as well. Good job!!

X3CXtBkt7BXjDwrowHQaqg.text: The best Chinese food around hands down. Everything is fresh and delicious and the family is the sweetest! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huge portion of General Tso &#39;s Chicken, comes with white rice
Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable Lo Mein

u1753GLCX5Mt0sOXBhU2UQ.text: This was my first time ordering takeout (but was highly recommended by friends) and have to say I was very pleased! The employees were so friendly and the food was amazing and the price was very good!!!

1sCutavHfu6uE9oBMNMdHQ.text: The $15 minimum for delivery is ridiculous! Pick up is not convenient. Guess I'll order elsewhere from now on.

kyMK6KtfWoYHvqLPvNKKEg.text: I think they have the best egg rolls I have ever eaten. I usually het the sesame chicken and its always good.

hrL_9PbVhCiHuQQa47mf1A.text: Sigh. Since moving to the South Hills, I have yet to find a decent Chinese restaurant, especially one that will deliver to the McNeilly corridor (I'm looking at you, Amazing Wok). Unfortunately, Wang's was no exception. Two stars for sake of the fact that the two portions of General Tsos only made one of us sick -- but still... I'm sorry, but there's just not much good to say here.

6MMItRF3N_h051zPnyulNQ.text: This Chinese restaurant's takeout is GREAT for the price. And the staff was really nice. I accidentally ordered the garlic sauce, not know it had soy sauce in it and I have a soy allergy. They changed my order without charge even though the mistake was mine. I got the white sauce instead and it was great! Definitely recommend highly!

K6Ux960T4HjdmqjC8HsVDw.text: Wang's Kitchen is a little hole in the wall on the border of Carrick/Brentwood... but MAN, do they have awesome food!   I personally have not ventured far past their General Tso's chicken.. the sauce is out of this world good! It's my favorite General Tso's around! They are very generous with their portion sizes as well!  I also love their veggie entree too! TONS of veggies and the sauce is awesome! They always provide you with tons of sauce, so asking for extra is not necessary!  Their lo main noodles are awesome too! One container and I have dinner, lunch and another dinner.. they PACK the container to capacity!  Wang's Kitchen is awesome- although they are not a place that I would recommend eating in at. For me, I have only ordered take out. They do have a space available for eating in, but it's not very large and it's loud in there as well. Take out is the way to go!  Overall, AWESOME food and consistently good service too!

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lunch portion of general tso&#39;s chicken! Noms!

AAjigm3Tdpa7jcq3AqNF4g.text: I order regularly from Wang's Kitchen. I believe it is the best Chinese cuisine in the south hills. I like the seafood wontons & egg rolls. Their General Tso's chicken is also good. They usually have someone answering the phone that is able to clearly speak and understand English, which is always helpful. They always get our order right.

Vqzurxs7putqmaCO-gszCQ.text: My go to for quick and tasty Chinese food. The food is good and reasonably priced. This food is just as good as some other places that charge a lot more.

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KDw3YCT0DvOshbLRbNBdYA.text: Good prices. It's your typical Chinese food. Cashiers are always friendly and the ones who take orders over the phone. Food is always nice and hot when I pick and they don't stare you down when you grab more than a necessary portion of sauces lol. What? Don't act like you don't do it.

PE6tUiFihnC1rolxCWaBtw.text: I was going to stop at china wok, but the reviews were bad. So I came here. One of the best take out Chinese places around. I found my new hidden gem. This place would be best for take out especially if you want something in a hurry. My food was finished in 10 minutes. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SarGnZSjt98aC9HMPbR2LA.text: It's literally my only delivery option, so I take it! But all the chicken dishes kind of taste the same. I'm not a fan of the big chunks of onion in the fried rice. But the wonton soup, I order a large because it is that tasty!! The chicken lo mein is also very yummy. And delivery tells you 45 minutes but most of the time it's 15-20.

9WWp112tgB2TQK4VcvL3TQ.text: I really enjoyed my shrimp fried rice; it was exactly what I expected quality-wise from a small, no-frills Chinese food place. My boyfriend was pretty disappointed by his chicken with curry sauce though. It didn't have much flavor and left a lot to be desired. For the price and convenience, I'll probably go back a second time, but it's not someplace I'd really recommend to a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Wang's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small shrimp fried rice.

1Xp7GVqyrXOkFgbTvTciMA.text: Best Chinese food delivery in Brentwood. Food is flavorful, delivery is prompt, nothing else compares.

q6aGwObbJIZ-Xp90aRUCjw.text: Not a fan of this place.  I stopped in for lunch and got Szechuan chicken.  As a person who comes from Brooklyn, New York which has a huge Chinese population (and many Chinese and Vietnamese restaurants along Avenue U and the East Teens, I've become accustomed to a non-sweet Chinese cuisine.  Pittsburgh, however, especially as you get further away from the Chinese restaurants of Squirrel Hill which cater to many Chinese mainland CMU students, seems to love "sweet and preferably sweeter".  Sure enough, the Szechuan chicken was far, far sweeter than I prefer.  I also got hot and sour soup (my favorite) which had a lot of good stuff in it but was, unfortunately, pretty much tasteless.  I won't be back.  I will, however, return to another Chinese place nearby on Brownsville Road in Carrick.  Number One Kitchen was it?  I rather liked that lunch special.  But was it good by accident or is it consistently good?  I hope it's the latter.

SqAST5CmfvaYBPDZyv_gpw.text: This is my current fave Chinese Food Restaurant. They have both; genral tso shrimp and chicken with snow peas on the menu.  These are not easy to find.   They have really good dumplings. They aren't just breakfast sausage wrapped in dough, like some places like to give you. The sauce is okay too, but I've had better.   Now that Lotus Garden is gone, this is where you'll want to order your Sweet new Sour chicken but be sure to ask for it extra crispy or it will be soggy when it gets to you.
